title: Minitab Output
question_text:
The data below shows mini tab output for the relationship between the number of cricket chirps per minute and temperature.
The regression equation for this relationship is:
$Temp = 44+0.993x$
Which of the following statements is true concerning the least squares regression line?
tables:
PredictorCoefSt Devt RatioP
Constant44.0131.82724.090
Number0.993400.0652315.230
S=1.536R-Sq = 95.9%R-sq(adj) = 95.5%----

choices.text: One would predict the temperature to be about $0.993$ degrees if there are no chirps.
One would expect the temperature to be about $0.993$ degrees higher for every extra chirp per minute heard.
The least squares regression line has a slope of about $44$ degrees.
The least squares regression line will have a negative slope.
One would expect about $44$ chirps per minute if it were $100$ degrees outside.
